sourceMeaningMnemonic: Press your <radical>fingers</radical> in someone's <radical>skin</radical> to <kanji>expose</kanji> what's underneath. This is pretty gross, but sometimes it's more important that you expose the cause of the problem, than avoiding something uncomfortable.
meaningInfo: Close your eyes. Picture someone's arm. Now touch their skin with your fingers and peel it back to expose the muscles and bones underneath.
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>expose</kanji> a small hole under their skin and <reading>he</reading>at (<ja>ひ</ja>) comes pouring out. Aha! You knew there was something wrong under here. Apparently there's something under this person's skin that's exuding way too much heat.
readingInfo: Imagine the heat steaming out, like it's coming out of a teapot, not out of somebody's arm skin.
